intro: Porophyllum selloi, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico and the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Porophyllum selloi is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas.
